description: People preparing to watch Monday's total eclipse of the sun need to protect their vision during the event, eye doctors say.
title: Eclipse viewing safety: Keeping your & your kid's vision safe

description: Just a single, unguarded glance at a solar eclipse can result in a lifetime of vision loss, eye health experts warn.
title: Why unprotected eclipse gazing will leave you seeing stars

description: Europe's top rights court will on Tuesday issue unprecedented verdicts in three separate cases on the responsibility of states in the face of global warming, rulings that could force governments to adopt more ambitious climate policies.
title: Top Europe rights court to issue landmark climate verdicts

description: When a rare total solar eclipse sweeps across North America on Monday, scientists will be able to gather invaluable data on everything from the sun's atmosphere to strange animal behaviors—and even possible effects on humans.
title: What do scientists hope to learn from total solar eclipse in US?

description: Greece on Sunday raised its wildfire alert level to "high risk" after dozens of blazes broke out, the civil protection ministry said.
title: Greece raises wildfire alert level after spate of blazes

description: A new Javan rhinoceros calf has been spotted at an Indonesian national park, giving hope for the conservation of one of the world's most endangered mammals.
title: Rare Javan rhino calf spotted in Indonesia

description: Clouds are likely to spoil the view of the total solar eclipse in Texas and other spots along the path in North America, according to forecasts on Saturday,
title: Eclipse weather forecast: clear skies in the Northeast, clouds in Texas

description: As the total solar eclipse on April 8, 2024, draws closer, a vibrant community of enthusiastic amateur radio operators, known as "hams," is gearing up for an exciting project with the Ham Radio Science Citizen Investigation (HamSCI) group. Our goal is clear and ambitious: to use the moon's shadow as a natural laboratory to uncover the intricacies of the ionosphere, a layer of Earth's atmosphere crucial for radio communication.
title: Citizen science group plans to use the 2024 eclipse for ionospheric discovery

description: More than 150 years ago, a San Francisco whaler noticed something about killer whales that scientists may be about to formally recognize—at least in name.
title: Scientists say these killer whales are distinct species: It could save them

description: The universe is still expanding at an accelerating rate, but it may have slowed down recently compared to a few billion years ago, early results from the most precise measurement of its evolution yet suggested Thursday.
title: The universe's accelerated expansion might be slowing down

description: A new study by scientists from Japan explores the propagation of quantum information within interacting boson systems like Bose-Einstein condensates (BECs), revealing the potential for accelerated transmission unlike previously thought.
title: Scientists investigate information propagation in interacting bosonic systems
